instructions:
Split wings at each joint and discard tips; pat dry and shake on Season-All. Place on a Pamed baking pan
and bake wings, uncovered, at 325 F for 30 minutes. *(May be frozen at this point and used later with
variations below.)* Remove from pan and place in container. Combine hot sauce with melted margarine and
pour over chicken wings. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours or overnight.
Before serving, broil wings 3 to 4 inches from heat for 5 minutes on first side and 3 minutes on second
side, brushing with reserved marinade. Brush with any remaining marinade just before serving. Serves 4.

VARIATIONS:
For Smoky Wings substitute 1/4 cup Liquid Smoke for Red Hot sauce in above recipe. 
*(Rev. 2/13/98)*
For other variations see:
"Sara Lee's Marinade and Barbecue Sauce" and "Marinades and Barbecue Sauces".
ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick) butter or margarine, melted
name: Buffalo Wings
